newsitem.title: NORWAY: ALPINE SKIING-MEN'S DOWNHILL DELAYED BY HIGH WINDS.
newsitem.headline: ALPINE SKIING-MEN'S DOWNHILL DELAYED BY HIGH WINDS.

text.p: The start of a men's Alpine World Cup downhill on Saturday has been delayed 30 minutes because of high winds.
The winds blew over a scoreboard in the finish area injuring a spectator.
The race, originally scheduled for 1030 GMT, will now start at 1100 GMT.
The penultimate downhill of the season has been disruted by bad weather all week, limiting the skiers to just one practice session on the Olympiabakken course.
Rain forced the cancelation of final training on Friday.
